definitions.definition: a natural substance found in food that is an essential part of what humans and animals need to help them grow and stay healthy. There are many different vitamins.
definitions.labels: (British English)(especially North American English)(especially North American English)(British English)(especially North American English)(especially British English)

examples.text: The plants are an excellent source of **vitamins and minerals**.
She tried changing her diet and taking vitamins.
Many juices are fortified with vitamins.
Fish is rich in vitamins and minerals.
Potatoes provide vitamins A and C, as well as calcium.
Some people are getting too much vitamin A.
The doctor told me to take vitamins regularly.

wordOrigin: early 20th cent.: from Latin vita ‘life’ + amine, because vitamins were originally thought to contain an amino acid.
